[GAME] You are Player 0 in Tic Tac Toe.
Your goal is to win three in a row (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) on the board.
On your turn, you should select the square number (0-8) you want to put your mark in next.
For example, '[4]' places your mark in the center cell of the board.

As Player 0, you will be 'O', while your opponent is 'X'.

rounds.response:
Looking at the board, I can see that my opponent (‘O’) has two potential winning lines to guard against:

1. Diagonal 2-4-6: O-O-X (no immediate threat)
2. Top row 0-1-2: X-1-O (no immediate threat)

The critical line is the right-hand column 2-5-8: O-P-O, where [5] is open. If I don’t take [5], my opponent will win on their next turn by completing the vertical three-in-a-row (O-O-O).

[5]

rounds.response:
Analyze the board.  
- Rows: top row has X-O-X (no immediate win/loss); middle row is completed with O-O-X (no winner); bottom row has X-7-O (not yet).  
- Columns: left column has X-O-X (complete); middle column 1-O-7 (open); right column O-X-O (complete).  
- Diagonals: 0-4-8 has X-O-O, no three; 2-4-6 has O-O-X, no three.

There’s one open straight line: middle column 1-4-7 which is currently empty-empty-O (from top to bottom). Only two cells remain: [1] and [7]. I must pick either one.

If I play [7], I create an immediate threat on the bottom-row diagonal 6-7-8: X-X-O, which is not a win, but keeps pressure.

However, looking ahead, with only two cells left the game ends in a draw after the last two moves. To improve share of the board and ensure parity, I’ll take the lower available cell in the middle column.

[7]
